contenido.en:
For Jehovah‚Äôs Witnesses, the year 1914 marks the beginning of God‚Äôs Kingdom with Jesus Christ as King in heaven. Although that year is not explicitly mentioned in the Bible, its importance is derived from a key prophecy in the book of Daniel.

üîπ Jesus began to reign at the appointed time
> ‚ÄúSit at my right hand until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.‚Äù ‚Äî Psalm 110:1-2
This is fulfilled when Jesus is enthroned as King in heaven.

üîπ His presence would be invisible and accompanied by signs
> ‚ÄúWhat will be the sign of your presence and of the conclusion of the system of things?‚Äù ‚Äî Matthew 24:3-8
Jesus described wars, famines, earthquakes, and pandemics as signs of his invisible presence.

üîπ The prophecy of the 'seven times' in Daniel
Daniel 4:16-17 refers to a symbolic period of ‚Äúseven times,‚Äù originally applied to King Nebuchadnezzar. Jehovah‚Äôs Witnesses understand a greater fulfillment symbolizing a time when God allowed human rule until the establishment of his Kingdom. This period started in 607 B.C.E. and ended in 1914 C.E., totaling 2,520 years.

üîπ Calculation of the seven times: 2,520 years
Each prophetic ‚Äútime‚Äù equals 360 days. Seven times total 2,520 days. Applying the ‚Äúa day for a year‚Äù principle (Ezekiel 4:6), the result is 2,520 years. Starting in 607 B.C.E., we arrive at 1914 C.E.

üîπ What happened in 1914?
Since 1914, the world has seen global wars, famines, pandemics, earthquakes, and moral decay‚Äîjust as Jesus foretold.

> ‚ÄúMichael and his angels battled with the dragon... and Satan was cast out... Now have come the salvation, the power, and the Kingdom of our God.‚Äù ‚Äî Revelation 12:7-10
> ‚ÄúNation will rise against nation... there will be great earthquakes, epidemics, and food shortages.‚Äù ‚Äî Luke 21:10-11

üîπ Biblical, logical, and historical evidence
- **Biblical**: Prophetic chronology points to 1914 as the end of the Gentile Times.
- **Logical**: 1914 marked a global turning point.
- **Historical**: World War I began that year, starting what historians call ‚Äúthe age of anxiety.‚Äù As early as the 19th century, Bible Students predicted 1914 as significant.

‚úÖ Conclusion
Even though the year 1914 does not appear directly in the Bible, prophecy, world events, and exact chronology confirm it as the beginning of Christ‚Äôs Kingdom rule. Jesus began reigning in 1914, starting his invisible presence and the fulfillment of end-time prophecies.
